greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{k=1..inf} 1/(10^k-1).
comment: Sum_{k>=1} x^k/(1-x^k) = sum_{k>=1} tau(k)*x^k. Choosing x = 1/10 gives the result. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Oct 21 2002
reference: Amarnath Murthy, Some interesting results on d(N), the number of divisors of a natural number, page 463, Octogon Mathematical Magazine, Vol. 8 No. 2, October 2000.
formula: Fast computation via Lambert series: 0.122324243426... = Sum_{n>=1} x^(n^2)*(1+x^n)/(1-x^n) where x=1/10. - _Joerg Arndt_, Oct 18 2020
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 29 2002
